data.title: Parking in St Malo
data.meta_description:
Could anybody advise where to park in St Malo with a 7.5m motorhome?

We want to view the city.

Thanks
data.text:
Aug 3, 2021

118

257

Caterham-on-the-Hill, UK

Funster No

83,175

MH

Pegaso - 740

Monday at 3:41 PM

#2

Les Ilots

35400 Saint Malo.

Just outside the city but a decent aire for 12 euros. It's on Park4Night and probably Serach4Sites too. There's a regular bus service into the city itself. we only stayed there one night but it was ok, close to the beach and a few shops nearby too.

Not sure if you mean just a park up or a stop over. If its the latter, we have stayed on the campsite across the harbour a few times. If I was going again, that's where I would stop. Camping de la Cite d'Aleth https://www.searchforsites.co.uk/marker.php?id=3110

Just outside the city but a decent aire for 12 euros. It's on Park4Night and probably Serach4Sites too. There's a regular bus service into the city itself. we only stayed there one night but it was ok, close to the beach and a few shops nearby too.

That’s where we stayed 2 years ago, just an easy 20 minute cycle ride to the city

Monday at 6:18 PM

#5

Les Ilots

35400 Saint Malo.

Just outside the city but a decent aire for 12 euros. It's on Park4Night and probably Serach4Sites too. There's a regular bus service into the city itself. we only stayed there one night but it was ok, close to the beach and a few shops nearby too.

We stayed there too several years ago, not initially by design but because the municipal campsite (in an old fort?) near the port was closed at the time. Nice little Aire, conveniently located near a small town square and the bus terminus as stated. I'd consider staying there again if going to St. Malo.

#7

We tried to park our 6.4m PVC and failed in September. We then used the park and ride facility. Good parking for MH and quite a few there. Good bus service into the old town and free with the car park entry ticket. I think you could legally overnight there and there were toilets on the site but I didn’t look for anything else.

When we visit St.Malo we now no longer bother with the aires or parking having failed each time to get in them but use the camp site here :

Good walk / cycle and an interesting site with some great history.

Daniel

#10

When we visited St Malo this year stayed over at the park and ride at Rue Paul Feval. Think it was 12Euro for the night but you get the bus at the gate which is included in the price.

Hope it helps, it’s a beautiful city to visit.
